title: Help syncing Phone bookmark data to new computer
content: bold textI need to sync my phone to my new computer so I can get my bookmarks and passwords transferred over to my new computer. I am afraid to scan the QR code because it reads as if it will sync this empty canvas to my phone and wipe all of my data out. What steps do I need to take?
creator: natestone

title: How to disable Warning: Potential Security Risk Ahead warning?
content: This annoying warning pops up everytime I remote into the webui of a ubiquity wireless antenna for my consulting job. How do I make this stop so I don't have to be bombarded by this nonsense at my already difficult job?
creator: gsrgtrdg4565653

title: Firefox won't launch after new update
content:
Hi,

Since I updated to the most recent version, Firefox hasn't worked.

When clicked, Firefox doesn't launch, no error message shows, and no processes appear in task manager.

I have uninstalled and reinstalled, deleted the folders and reinstalled, run as administrator with no change. If there is anything else I can try, please let me know.
creator: rob.a.domanski

title: How to convert json bookmarkfiles and import into new firefox browser?
content:
Long story short...I lost my hard drive, reinstalled windows....I never used a firefox login on this laptop. I do have a backup of all my data/appfiles --- actually i cloned the failed drive. So I have this directory in my backups:

D:\Users\USER\AppData\Roaming\Mozilla\Firefox\Profiles\810aqnu7.default-release-1636153011215\bookmarkbackups. There are a bunch of JSON versions of bookmarkfiles there stored....how can i get my bookmarks back with these files?

where is the "current bookmark files" stored? which directory?

thanks in advance.
creator: s3m3a3

title: account help
content:
Why does Firefox forget who I am?

I use the same computer every day for years and years, but Firefox forgets my settings every month or two.
creator: sxplay

title: Can't get on web site
content: Trying to get on a web site. But don't know how to do it?
creator: jenniferjaydant

title: Is it possible to create a shortcut to the notification manager?
content: Hi, When you click "settings" in notifications, in the privacy and security settings, a new window opens instead of a tab, so this setting has no URL of its own. In Chromium-based browsers they have the URL "*browser name*://settings/content/notifications", so I could add this URL to bookmarks and access it quickly. Is there any way to do something similar in Firefox? Thanks
creator: Chemitaa
